definition: to overflow/(literary) excessive/old variant of 鎰|镒[yi4]

sentences.english: The air smelled like smoke and roared with noise.
sentences.chinese: 空气中漫溢着烟尘，充斥着噪音。

sentences.english: The results showed that the overflowing phenomenon occurred in front of the closed gate at first.
sentences.chinese: 结果显示，水流漫溢现象最先发生在被关闭节制闸前。

sentences.english: The water in the bathtub overflows and is wasted.
sentences.chinese: 澡盆中的水漫溢出来，白白浪费了。

sentences.english: The into the forest with great refreshing scent.
sentences.chinese: 接著到了森林里面，漫溢松柏的芳香。

sentences.english: We are most brimming with aliveness when we are just about to gain a solid form.
sentences.chinese: 我们用漫溢的活力想获取一种稳定的生活方式。

definition: to be full to overflowing/to be brimming over with
to pervade/to fill the air/diffuse/everywhere present/about to inundate (water)/permeated by (smoke)/filled with (dust)/to saturate (the air with fog, smoke etc)
variant of 彌漫|弥漫[mi2 man4]
to dissipate everywhere (of light, sound, gas etc)
to well up/to spill out (of water from a spring)
to ripple/to undulate/also written 蕩漾|荡漾
(of a perfume or a foul odor) permeating the whole place/(of grease etc) dripping everywhere/flowing all over the place
to cascade down/to flow in torrents/(fig.) outpouring (of emotions)
to overflow/(literary) excessive/old variant of 鎰|镒[yi4]
